item.description:

item.title: Deezer chases Spotify and Amazon Music with its own AI playlist generator
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Deezer is the latest music streaming app to introduce an AI playlist feature. The company announced on Monday that a select number of paid users will be able to create custom playlists with a text prompt using its “Playlist with AI” feature. The launch of the new feature comes a few months after Spotify and […]

item.title: Caliza lands $8.5 million to bring real-time money transfers to Latin America using USDC
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
Real-time payments are becoming commonplace for individuals and businesses, but not yet for cross-border transactions. That’s what Caliza is hoping to change, starting with Latin America. Founded in 2021 by American entrepreneur Ezra Kebrab, who now lives in São Paulo, Brazil, Caliza offers an alternative to transfers made via SWIFT, which are the norm in […]

item.title: How VanMoof’s new owners plan to win over its old customers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
When VanMoof declared bankruptcy last year, it left around 5,000 customers who had preordered e-bikes in the lurch. Now VanMoof is up and running under new management, and the company’s current owners are courting those same customers by offering them a €1,000 discount off a new bike.  It’s an audacious strategy, one that bets on […]

item.title: Mitti Labs aims to make rice farming less harmful to the climate, starting in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Mitti Labs aims to transform rice farming in India and other South Asian markets by reducing methane emissions by 50% and water consumption by 30%.

item.title: Google reportedly in talks to acquire cloud security company Wiz for $23B
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Google’s parent company Alphabet might be on the verge of making its biggest acquisition ever. The Wall Street Journal reports that Alphabet is in advanced talks to acquire Wiz for around $23 billion. While the deal isn’t finalized, the WSJ says it could come together soon. Wiz offers an all-in-one approach to cloud security, ingesting […]

item.title: Hank Green reckons with the power — and the powerlessness — of the creator
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Hank Green has had a while to think about how social media has changed us. He started making YouTube videos in 2007 with his brother, novelist John Green, at a time when the first iPhone was in development, MySpace was still relevant and Instagram didn’t exist. And he’s pulling inspiration from McDonald’s to get there.  The prototype, which made its global debut this week at the Goodwood Festival of Speed, is an interesting proof of concept. India is struggling to get new smartphone buyers, as millions of Indians don’t go for an upgrade and continue to be on feature phones.

item.title: Meet the soft robots that can amputate limbs and fuse with other robots
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Roboticists at The Faboratory at Yale University have developed a way for soft robots to replicate some of the more unsettling things that animals and insects can accomplish — say, a reptile self-amputating a limb or ants building bridges by temporarily fusing their bodies. In one demo video, we see a soft quadruped robot crawling […]

item.title: If you’re an AT&T customer, your data has likely been stolen
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall
item.description:
This week, AT&T confirmed it will begin notifying around 110 million AT&T customers about a data breach that allowed cybercriminals to steal the phone records of “nearly all” of its customers. The stolen data contains phone numbers and AT&T records of calls and text messages during a six-month period in 2022, the company says. If […]

item.title: Whistleblowers accuse OpenAI of ‘illegally restrictive’ NDAs
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Whistleblowers have accused OpenAI of placing illegal restrictions on how employees can communicate with government regulators, according to a letter obtained by The Washington Post. Lawyers representing anonymous whistleblowers sent the letter to Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) chair Gary Gensler. The letter refers to a separate, formal complaint asking the SEC to investigate OpenAI’s […]
